title: What is the 1000th term of the Fibonacci sequence? - Quora

response.answer_text: Would you settle for the cross value? 1000/24 = 41.6666667 (0.6666667 is 16/24 or reduced to 2/3’s) after 41 one cycles of 24 repeating we’d be 984th Fib term. The first twelve go to 996 putting the 4th term in the 2nd half of the cycle up to bat for the 1000th term. 1 1 2 3 5 8 4 3 7 1 8 9 (F1 - F12)8 8 7 6! <- (F13 - F16 and bingo) the 1000th Fib term has a cross value of 6. Does the Gigantic number matter ? OR does the core truth matter ? I’ll leave it up to you. Thanks for A2A, Peace, DjL.
